text.sentence: Technology | U.S. Software twenty six February two thousand sixteen
Net Adds Better in fourQ and FY seventeen; Entering Trough Year of Transition
It was a positive call ­ subscribers beat, guidance for adds in FY seventeen are better, and longterm margins are going up.

FY seventeen will be an abnormal year with license going away, but it will also be the trough of the transition, after which we should see acceleration in subscribers and cash flow, so after a couple more quarters, there could be light at the end of this tunnel.
We are tweaking our price target to dollar seventy based on sixteen seventeenx our FYtwenty FCF of dollar oneB .
ADSK reported fourQsixteen revenue/EPS of dollar six hundred forty eightM/ dollar .twenty
one versus our dollar six hundred eighty threeM/ dollar .twelve and street's dollar six hundred thirty fiveM/ dollar .eleven.
Subscriber additions came in at one hundred ninek versus our ninety threek which was at the high end of their guide.
New model sub adds were ~sixty onek, up q/q and maintenance adds were ~forty eightk also up q/q as customers bought licenses ahead of the two/one deadline on standalone products.
EPS upside came mostly from higher margins as cost controls increase, but also lower tax rate.
FY seventeen subscriber adds are better than our estimate; revenue lighter than street, but remember this is the trough year for the income statement.
FY seventeen will have several moving parts to ADSK's model with perpetual license being discontinued entirely starting eight/one.
This is the reason why FY seventeen will be the trough year for the income statement, but also the year that subscribers inflect.
For this reason, we were glad to see FY seventeen subscriber net add guidance of four hundred seventy five five hundred twenty fivek, versus our four hundred seventy sixk estimate.

Flat expenses are extending to FYeighteen effectively raising long term target margin; also potential for more than dollar oneB in FCF in FYtwenty: Perhaps the biggest surprise on the call was that total expenses should remain flat in FYeighteen as well ­ remember, management noted it will keep expenses flat in FY seventeen, so with this continuing into FYeighteen with modest growth in future years, this effectively raised long term margin targets which we reflected in our estimates.
Furthermore, management called out the prospect for ~ dollar six/share in FCF in FYtwenty which equates to more than our base case dollar oneB in FCF.

U.S. Software Industry View: POSITIVE Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand sixteenA two thousand five hundred four three hundred seventy eight two hundred eighty one twenty one hundred ninety four .eighty
two thousand seventeenE two thousand eight seventy three two hundred fifteen four hundred ninety seven one hundred seventy two .seventy
two thousand eighteenE two thousand two hundred thirty two one hundred sixty five eight two hundred sixty nine twenty four .ten
two thousand nineteenE two thousand six hundred ninety four hundred sixty three three hundred seventy six one hundred five two hundred fifty four one.eleven
We believe the subscription model transition offers a multi year revenue growth, margin expansion, and cash flow generation story through FYtwenty.
We think investors will value the stock off FYeighteen, which at current levels offer an attactive risk/reward in our opinion.

In our upside scenario, we assume managements revenue with ~thirty percent operating margins, FYtwenty net cash levels, and an assigned multiple of twenty twox discounted back at a ten percent cost of capital.

In our downside scenario, we assume ~ten percent haircut to our current estimates with ~twenty percent operating margins, current net cash levels, and an assigneed multiple of fourteenx discounted back at a fifteen percent cost of capital.

Income statement Revenue EBITDA Operating profit Pre tax income Net income EPS Diluted shares DPS Margin and return data EBITDA margin Operating margin Pre tax margin Net margin ROIC ROA ROE Balance sheet and cash flow Net PP and E Goodwill Cash and equivalents Total assets Short and long term debt Other long term liabilities Total liabilities Net debt/ Shareholders' equity Change in working capital Cash flow from operations Capital expenditure Free cash flow Valuation and leverage metrics P/E EV/sales EV/EBITDA Equity FCF yield Dividend yield Net debt/EBITDA Total debt/capital Selected operating metrics License revenue Maintenance revenue Services revenue Deferred revenue
We believe the bull points from this quarter include: · Beat top end of subscriber net add guidance, which did not include the subscribers
ADSK reported fourQfifteen subscriber net additions of one hundred ninek versus our ninety threek estimate which was at the high end of their implied guidance range for fourQ.
We note this did not include ~twenty fivek subs from enterprise business arrangements where subscribers are counted once usage starts, which will not start until oneQ seventeen by our estimates.
and sounds like comp plans and focus is on subscriber growth.

The net add guidance for FY seventeen of four hundred seventy five five hundred twenty fivek was better than our recently lowered estimate of four hundred seventy fivek ­ we think street estimates had a wide range, so tough to say how it compared to consensus, but it was better than ours at the midpoint.
We also heard specific commentary about realigned compensation plans focused on subscriber growth, which reminded us of PTC's strategy of realigning compensation plans to drive subscription.

Recall, management guided twoHsixteen and FY seventeen to low single digit growth/flat total expenses ­ they extended that guidance to FYeighteen, which is taking up our margin estimates through the trough of the transition.
But more importantly, with growth expected in FYnineteen and beyond, the long term margin target is effectively going higher given the lower base of total expenses in FY seventeen and FYeighteen.
We have always been slightly lower than the twenty five percent + margin target set at analyst day, but this takes us up to twenty six percent, or up ~four hundred basis points.
The pillar of our thesis on the stock has been the prospect of reaching ~ dollar oneB in FCF in FYtwenty, the first normal year post transition.
Management though called out the potential to reach dollar six/share in FCF, which on current share count implies dollar one.three
We are not modelling to that yet until we see subscribers and ARPS inflect later this summer, but it was encouraging to hear.

Furthermore, management spoke of longer term guidance of dollar eleven/share in FCF in FYtwenty three ­ we think its positive to see the growth, but we have not introduced estimates out that far given the longer time horizon.
We believe the bear points from this quarter include: · Street was probably high on FY seventeen revenue, so headline guidance is lower than

FY seventeen revenue guidance of dollar one thousand nine hundred fifty dollar two thousand fiftyM is lower than the street's previous dollar two thousand ninety threeM but inline with our dollar two thousand fiveM estimate.
Given the phase out of perpetual and moving parts in FY seventeen, we would not be surprised if the street was high, but the headline could be viewed negatively.
here, but on the back of ANSS' lower FYsixteen guidance, and general economic data points, we were surprised to hear that there was little degradation in demand.
That is great fundamentally, but we could see bears perhaps wondering if that increases risk to the business if conditions worsen and potentially catch up to ADSK.
We show how actual fourQsixteen results compared to our estimates in the table below.
Barclays | Autodesk Inc. FIGURE one Actual fourQsixteen Results vs. Barclays Estimates

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays

CE: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker in equity securities issued by Autodesk Inc.. J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a liquidity provider and/or trades regularly in the securities by Autodesk Inc. and/or in any related derivatives.
K: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received non investment banking related compensation from Autodesk Inc. within the past twelve months.
M: Autodesk Inc. is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
Valuation Methodology: Our dollar seventy price target is based onsixteen seventeenx our FYtwenty FCF of dollar oneB .
Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: We see three downside risks to our Overweight rating.
First, if ADSK is unable to reach FYtwenty goals of twenty four percent ARR CAGR and twenty three twenty five percent operating margin, estimates could deteriorate causing the stock to under perform.
Second, while there is some cannibalization expected from new licensing options, if this is greater than expected, estimates could go down.
Third, ADSK sells into an economically sensitive customer base, so if the fragile recovery were to deteriorate, estimates could go down, and the stock could underperform.
